Pemangkasan Eselon, Korpri Minta Kesejahteraan PNS Diutamakan
06 Nov 2019 by Bisnis.com, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Terkait dengan rencana pemerintah untuk memangkas pejabat eselon III dan IV, Korps Pegawai Republik Indonesia (Korpri) meminta pemerintah mengutamakan kesejahteraan pegawai negeri sipil.
Ketua Korpri Zudan Arif Fakhrulloh mengatakan, yang perlu diutamakan dalam membuat desain kebijakan terkait dengan pemangkasan eselon ini adalah bahwa pegawai negeri sipil sejahtera. "Intinya kesejahteraan," kata Zudan kepada Bisnis, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Untuk itu, Zudan menyarankan agar pemerintah melakukan uji coba pemangkasan eselon terlebih dahulu. Uji coba dapat dilakukan di beberapa kementerian dengan sejumlah indikator. Pertama sebagai garda terdepan uji coba pertama dilakukan di Kementerian Pendayagunaan Aparatur Negara Reformasi Birokrasi (Kemenpan RB).
Kemudian, kata Zudan, pemerintah dapat melanjutkan uji coba pemangkasan eselon di kementerian yang memiliki jumlah pegawai sedikit. "Kementerian yang pegawai sedikit kemudian diuji coba di kementerian besar, kemudian diuji coba di unit yang menangani perizinan," kata dia.
Menurut Zudan, uji coba itu perlu dilakukan agar pemerintah memiliki desain yang utuh terkait dengan kebijakan pemangkasan eselon III dan IV ini. Pemerintah juga disarankan untuk melakukan uji coba dengan tidak memotong eselon III dan IV di suatu institusi, berbarengan dengan uji coba pemangkasan tersebut.
"Tapi diberi sistem insentif [yang tidak dipangkas eselonnya] bisa berjalan apa tidak layanannya," kata Zudan.
Berdasarkan data Badan Kepegawaian Negara (BKN) per Juni 2019, total jumlah total eselon I sampai V mencapai 460.067 orang. Eselon IV sendiri berjumlah 327.058 atau 71,09 persen dari jumlah total.
Sementara itu, eselon III memiliki jumlah terbanyak kedua yakni 98.658 orang, diikuti eselon II yang berjumlah 19.463, kemudian eselon V sebanyak 14.313 orang dan eselon I berjumlah 575 orang.

Trimming Echelon, Korpri Asks Civil Servants' Welfare
Nov 6 2019 by Bisnis.com, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Regarding the government's plan to cut echelon III and IV officials, the Indonesian Civil Servants Corps (Korpri) asks the government to prioritize the welfare of civil servants.
The Head of Korpri Zudan Arif Fakhrulloh said that what needed to be prioritized in making policy designs related to this echelon pruning was that civil servants were prosperous. "The point is welfare," Zudan told Bisnis on Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
For this reason, Zudan suggested that the government conduct a trial of echelon pruning first. Trials can be conducted in several ministries with a number of indicators. First, as the front guard, the first trial was conducted at the Ministry of Administrative Reform and Bureaucracy Reform (Kemenpan RB).
Then, said Zudan, the government can continue the trial of cutting echelon in ministries that have a small number of employees. "Ministries with fewer employees are then tested in large ministries, then tested in units that handle licensing," he said.
According to Zudan, the trial needs to be carried out so that the government has a complete design related to this echelon III and IV pruning policy. The government is also advised to conduct trials by not cutting echelon III and IV at an institution, along with the trial of pruning.
"But given an incentive system [which is not trimmed by echelon] it can work or not the service," said Zudan.
Based on data from the State Personnel Agency (BKN) as of June 2019, the total number of echelon I to V reached 460,067 people. Echelon IV alone amounted to 327,058 or 71.09 percent of the total.
Meanwhile, echelon III had the second highest number of 98,658 people, followed by echelon II totaling 19,463, then echelon V totaling 14,313 people and echelon I totaling 575 people.
